materials.name: Course Details
materials.description: Days/Times: MW – 7:00 – 8:25 pm. Duration: August 26 - Dec 15 (16 weeks including finals). Units: 3; CSU/UC transferrable; Letter Grade Only. Course Web Site: Canvas via Mt. SAC portal (http://inside.mtsac.edu).

materials.name: Course Description
materials.description: Vector approach to static equilibrium of rigid bodies, forces, couples in two and three- dimensional space. Application of equilibrium principles to trusses, frames, and machines. Calculation of center-of-mass and centroid. Friction, moment of inertia, distributed and concentrated loads. Forces in cables and beams. Fluid statics. Introduction to virtual work. PRE-REQUISITES: PHYS 4A and MATH 181 (Calc 2).

materials.name: Required Materials
materials.description: Textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed. Also required: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator that is NCEES/SAT/ACT approved (e.g., TI-36, TI-84), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad (graph paper) is highly recommended.

materials.name: Grading Scale
materials.description: Homework: 10%, Midterm 1: 15%, Midterm 2: 15%, Midterm 3: 15%, Project: 20%, Final: 25%. Grade Scale: 90-100 A, 80-89 B, 70-79 C, 60-69 D, 59< F.

materials.name: Assignments and Assessments Policy
materials.description: Homework is assigned weekly and due one week later via CANVAS upload; late homework is not accepted. Midterms occur every 2-3 weeks. A group project is due during finals week.
